SX0001/24 AIP SUPPLEMENT EGKK/LONDON/GATWICK LONDON GATWICK AIRPORT: REDUCED NIGHT NOISE (RNN) TRIAL - APPROACH TRANSITION PROCEDURES VALIDITY: 11JAN24 - 28JUN24 THE PURPOSE OF THIS AIP SUPPLEMENT IS TO DETAIL THE TRIAL OPERATION AND INCORPORATION OF EIGHT RNP APPROACH TRANSITION PROCEDURES FOR USE AT LONDON GATWICK AIRPORT. ALL CARIER RNP1 EQUIPPED CAPPABLE TO RF LEG MUST HAVE THE RNP APPROACH TRANSITIONS, DETAILED WITHIN THIS DOCUMENT, CODED AND AVAILABLE FOR USE WHEN THE TRIAL COMMENCES. TRIAL PROC AVBL 0130-0500 (0030-0400). RWY 08R: AFELE 1A, EFMUC 1A, IFKIF 1A AND MOHIG 1A; RWY 26L: MUWAL 1D, VURJU 1D, TUFGA 1D AND LACOV 1D. **************************************************************** STAR RWY 08R RWY 26L ---------------------------------------------------------------- DISIT 1G; KIDLI 1G; MID 1X OTMET 1G; SIRIC 1G; TELTU 1G AFELE 1A MUWAL 1D ---------------------------------------------------------------- ABSAV 1G; GWC 1G; NEVIL 1G; VASUX 1G EFMUC 1A VURJU 1D ---------------------------------------------------------------- AMDUT 1G; KUNAV 1G IFKIF 1A TUFGA 1D ---------------------------------------------------------------- ARNUN 1G; BARMI 1G; KONAN 2G; TEBRA 2G MOHIG 1A LACOV 1D **************************************************************** THE TRIAL PROCEDURES ARE NOT CONNECTED TO THE GATWICK STARS. ATC WILL CLEAR AIRCRAFT TO THE START OF THE RELEVANT APPROACH TRANSITION WELL IN ADVANCE OF THE END OF THE STAR. IN THE EVENT THAT ATC CANNOT PROVIDE SUFFICIENT NOTICE TO THE CREWS THEY WILL BE VECTORED ONTO FINAL APPROACH OF AN APPROPRIATE IAP AS PER CURRENT OPERATIONS. IN THE EVENT THAT THE REQUIRED NAVIGATION EQUIPMENT FAILS, THE FLIGHT CREW SHALL ADVISE ATC THAT THEY CAN NO LONGER CONTINUE WITH THE APPROACH TRANSITION, OR ARE UNABLE TO ACCEPT THE PROCEDURE, USING THE PHRASEOLOGY:' (CALLSIGN), UNABLE RNP DUE EQUIPMENT.' A NOTAM WILL CONFIRM THE DATES AND TIMES OF THIS TRIAL, FOLLOWING WHICH THIS SUPPLEMENT AND THE ASSOCIATED PROCEDURES WILL BE WITHDRAWN.

#0071/24 CHART NOTAMR #0036/24 Q) EGKK/QFACX/LBT A) EGKK B) 2401090000 C) 2406282359 E) AOI TEMPO NIGHT APCH TRANSITIONS: REF AIP SUP 01/2024: TRIAL REDUCED NIGHT NOISE APPROACH TRANSITION PROCS THE TRIAL PROCS WILL BE AVBL BETWEEN 0130-0500++. THE TRIAL PROCS ARE NOT CONNECTED TO STARS. ATC WILL CLEAR ACFT TO THE START OF THE REVELANT APCH WELL IN ADVANCE OF THE END OF THE STAR. IN THE EVENT THAT ATC CANNOT PROVIDE SUFFICIENT NOTICE TO THE CREWS, THEY WILL BE VECTORED ONTO FINAL APCH OF AN APPROPRIATE IAC. CREWS CAN EXPECT THE FOLLOFING TRANSITIONS BASED ON THEIR STAR: STAR / RWY 08R / RWY 26L DISIT G, KIDLI G, MID X, OTMET G, SIRIC G, TELTU G / AFELE A / MUWAL D ABSAV G, GWC G, NEVIL G, VASUX G / EFMUC A / VURJU D AMDUT G, KUNAV G / IFKIF A / TUFGA D ARNUN G, BARMI G, KONAN G, TEBRA G / MOHIG A / LACOV D RCF: IF CLEARANCE HAS BEEN GIVEN AND ACKNOWLEDGED, CONTINUE WITH THE TRIAL APCH TRANSITION TO JOIN THE ILS APCH PROC, OTHERWISE ADOPT THE EXISTING APPROPRIATE PROCS. IN CASE THE REQUIRED NAVIGATION EQUIPMENT FAILS, CREW SHALL ADVISE ATC, USING PHRASEOLOGY: CALLSIGN, UNABLE RNP DUE TO EQUIPMENT. DATES AND TIMES OF TRIAL PROCS WILL BE CONFIRMED BY NOTAM.

SX0031/24 AIP SUPPLEMENT LFMN/NICE/COTE EXPERIMENTATION OF 4 INITIAL APPROACH PROCEDURES TO FACILITATE OPTIMIZED DESCENTS. VALIDITY: 18APR24 - 25DEC24 THIS AIP SUP CONCERNS THE OPERATIONAL ASSESSMENT OF OPTIMIZED DESCENT PROFILES ON THE INITIAL APPROACHES (INA = INITIAL APPROACH PROCEDURE) OF FLIGHTS INBOUND FOR NICE COTE D AZUR (LFMN). AN OPTIMIZED DESCENT MEANS A DESCENT WITH REDUCED FUEL CONSUMPTION AND NOISE POLLUTION (TO DESCEND CONTINUOUSLY, TO THE GREATEST POSSIBLE EXTENT, BY EMPLOYING MINIMUM ENGINE THRUST, IDEALLY IN A LOW DRAG CONFIGURATION, PRIOR TO THE FINAL APPROACH POINT). THROUGHOUT THE VALIDITY PERIOD OF THIS AIP SUP, AND WHEN CONDITIONS ALLOW (TRAFFIC, WEATHER, ETC.), THE CONTROLLER USES THE PROCEDURES PUBLISHED IN ORDER TO LIMIT RADAR VECTORING. THE CREWS, WITH THE INFORMATION OF THE DISTANCE REMAINING TO THE RUNWAY MUST PERFORM OPTIMIZED DESCENTS AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE THE OPERATIONAL ASSESSMENT WILL TAKE PLACE AT ANY TIME (DAY OR NIGHT), DURING LIGHT TRAFFIC SITUATION, ONCE THE AIRCRAFT HAS BEEN TRANSFERRED TO NICE APP. IF THE TRAFFIC SITUATION DOES NOT ALLOW THE USE OF THE TRAJECTORIES,THE PILOT SHOULD EXPECT RADAR VECTORING TOWARDS THE INITIAL FIX OF THE PROCEDURE IN USE. RNAV(GNSS) PROCEDURES: RWY04R RAPOT1M/1N RWY04L LEMPU1M/1N RWY04L/R BISBO1M/1N RWY22L/R SOTOX1M/1N

THE CHAPTER 22.2.3 IS UPDATED ACCORDINGLY: 22.2.3 COORDINATION WITH NETWORK ORLY AIRPORT PDS IS DIRECTLY CONNECTED TO THE NETWORK MANAGER OPERATION CENTER (NMOC) FOR DATA EXCHANGE (COLLABORATIVE MANAGEMENT OF FLIGHT UPDATES). DATA ARE AUTOMATICALLY EXCHANGED THROUGH DPI AND API MESSAGES WHICH INCLUDE TARGET TAKE-OFF TIME AND ESTIMED LANDING TIME, TAKEN INTO ACCOUNT BY THE NETWORK MANAGER OPERATION CENTER FOR EN-ROUTE TRAFFIC PREDICTION AND FOR SLOT ALLOCATION. DIFFERENT TYPES OF DPI AND API ARE: -GENERAL ARRIVAL PLANNING INFORMATION (G-API) -PREDICTED DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (P-DPI) -EARLY DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (E-DPI) -TARGET DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (T-DPI) -ATC DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (A-DPI) -CANCEL DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (C-DPI) THE REA MESSAGE IS NO LONGER TO BE USED REA AS IT IS REPLACED BY DPI MESSSAGES SYSTEMATICALLY AND AUTOMATICALLY SENT. ADS-B DATA FOR ECRA (EUROPEAN CONNECTED REGIONAL AIRPORTS PROGRAMME) OPERATIONS. 1.1.IN ORDER TO COOPERATE WITH ADS-B RECEIVER USED BY AIRPORT OPERATOR AND EUROCONTROL FOR USE OF THE ECRA PROGRAMME AT EINDHOVEN AIRPORT,PILOTS OF MODE S EQUIPPED ACFT WITH ADS-B FUNCTIONALITIES WHEN OPERATING ON THE GROUND SHALL: A)SELECT AUTO MODE AND THE ASSIGNED MODE A CODE OR B)IF AUTOMODE IS NOT AVAILABLE, SELECT ON (E.G.XPDR) AND THE ASSIGNED MODE A CODE. -FROM THE REQUEST FOR TOWER PUSH-BACK OR TAXI,WHICHEVER IS EARLIER -AFTER LANDING,CONTINUOUSLY UNTIL THE ACFT IS FULLY PARKED IN ITS STAND. -WHEN THE ACFT IS FULLY PARKED, FLT CREW SHALL SELECT STBY. 1.1.2.WHENEVER THE ACFT IS CAPABLE OF REPORTING ACFT IDENTIFICATION (I.E.CALLSIGN USED IN FLT), THIS SHOULD BE ENTERED (THROUGH THE FMS OR THE TRANSPONDER CONTROL PANEL) AT THE TIME OF THE REQUEST FOR TOWED PUSH-BACK OR TAXI, WHICHEVER IS EARLIER. 1.1.3.AIR CREW MUST USE THE ICAO DEFINED FORMAT TO ENTER THE ACFT IDENTIFICATION. 1.1.4.TO ENSURE THAT THE PERFORMANCE OF SYSTEMS BASED ON SSR FREQ (INCLUDING AIRBORNE TCAS AND SSR RADARS) IS NOT COMPROMISED, TCAS SHOULD NOT BE SELECTED BEFORE RECEIVING CLEARANCE TO LINE UP, AND SHOULD BE DESELECTED AFTER VACATING THE RWY.
